metadata.case_name: Ramnath Shriram Somani & Ors. v. Bank of Poona Ltd.

facts.text: The Bank of Poona Ltd. (Company) was incorporated in 1945, promoted by N.G. Parulekar and Murlidhar Chaturbhuj Loya. Authorised capital Rs. 50 lakhs (50,000 shares of Rs. 100 each). By end of April 1946, only 4,860 shares subscribed.

To comply with s. 277(1) Indian Companies Act 1913 requiring subscribed capital not less than half authorised capital, directors decided to subscribe for shares themselves or nominees. Narayandas Shriram Somani (director) decided to subscribe for 2000 shares in names of Jivanbai (mother), Goverjabai (wife), Kamalabai (Ramnath's wife, brother).

Board meeting May 25, 1946 attended by Murlidhar Loya, D.R. Nayak, Narayandas. Allotted 500 shares to Goverjabai, 500 to Kamalabai, 1000 to Jivanbai against applications signed by them, accompanied by hundis for Rs.25,000, Rs.12,500, Rs.12,500 drawn by Narayandas.
Same meeting sanctioned loan of Rs.60,000 to Ramnath. On May 28, 1946, Ramnath obtained loan against promissory note, loan account No.1/18 opened.

June 8, 1946 board resolved overdraft Rs.40,000 to Ramnath, account L.A.C. No.71 opened. Ramnath drew Rs.15,000 (June 27), Rs.25,000 (June 29). Balance application/allotment moneys paid June 22 (Rs.12,500 Goverjabai), June 28 (Rs.12,500 Kamalabai), June 29 (Rs.25,000 Jivanbai).
Subscription of 2000 shares financed by advances to Ramnath.
Dec 28, 1948: Ramnath indebted Rs.65,743-6-6 loan account, Rs.41,909-10-0 overdraft. Accounts closed, new loan account No.9 debit Rs.1,09,500, promissory note executed.
Ramnath repaid Rs.18,500 (Dec 29, 1950), Rs.1,500 (Jan 2, 1951). Jan 6, 1951 new loan Rs.20,000 to Ramkisan Ramratan Somani & Ramnath, joint promissory note, separate account.
Loan account No.9: Repaid Rs.1,00,000 (Dec 27, 1951 by Narayandas on behalf), Rs.4,198-8-0 (Dec 29, 1951), account closed.
Same date Dec 27, 1951: Narayandas obtained loan Rs.1,00,000, promissory note, letter of pledge/trust receipt for cloth/saris Rs.1,50,000, account No.6/184 opened.

Mar 18, 1954: Company filed Special Suit No.39/1954 vs Ramkisan Ramratan Somani & Ramnath for Rs.22,964-13-0 (loan account & promissory Jan 6,1951). Trial court dismissed Apr 23,1955; High Court decreed in FA 819/1955. Civil Appeal 801/1962.

Apr 24, 1954: Company filed Special Suit No.78/1954 vs Narayandas for Rs.109,099-14-4 (account 6/184 & promissory Dec 27,1951). Trial court dismissed Apr 23,1955; High Court decreed in FA 820/1955. Civil Appeal 802/1962.
Ramnath paid from own funds: Rs.750-4-0 interest overdraft Dec 12,1946; Rs.1,484-7-0 loan 1/18 Apr 21,1947; Rs.4,198-8-0 loan 9 Dec 29,1951; Rs.100 Jan 4,1954.

Shares dealt as owned: Some transferred by Jivanbai to third parties, proceeds to Narayandas loan; Jivanbai received 1000 shares, receipt Feb 25,1953; undertakings Dec 27,1951 Parulekar (500 shares), Loya (800); letter Jun 28,1954 to Parulekar.
Mar 3,1953: Narayandas letter declaring sarees Rs.1,50,000 as security.
Dec 27,1951: Company credited Rs.1,00,000 to Ramnath loan 9, debited Narayandas new loan 6/184; Narayandas acknowledged receipt, promissory note.

legal_issues.text: Whether allotment of 2000 shares on May 25,1946 invalid due to lack of quorum as Narayandas (interested director) voted, violating s.91B Indian Companies Act 1913.
Whether loans to Ramnath and Narayandas were genuine and intended to be repayable.
Whether book entries on Dec 27,1951 constituted valid loan to Narayandas.
Whether loans were illegal financial assistance for purchase of shares under s.54A Indian Companies Act 1913.

petitioner_arguments.text: Allotment of 2000 shares and loans not genuine; no intent for allottees to hold shares or borrowers to repay loans.
Allotment invalid: May 25,1946 meeting had only 3 directors including interested Narayandas; s.91B excludes his vote/presence for quorum; no disinterested quorum.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: s.91B Indian Companies Act 1913; Article 126 Articles of Association

petitioner_arguments.text: No cash loan to Narayandas Dec 27,1951; mere book entries; suit not maintainable as framed.
Loans financial assistance for purchase of shares, contravening s.54A; irrecoverable.
Assurances by Loya/Parulekar that Rs.1,00,000 for shares paid by Company on interest, shares sold, no liability; repayments from Company moneys.

respondent_arguments.text: Allotment and loans genuine; shares dealt as owned; repayments from own funds; secured by promissory notes, pledges.
s.54A point not raised properly below; loans part of banking business; 'purchase' excludes subscription/allotment per Re V.G.M. Holdings Ltd.
Book entries Dec 27,1951 amount to loan/payment per s.50 Indian Contract Act illustration (a).

court_reasoning.text: Allotment operative; allottees owners; shares transferred, receipts given; assurances by Loya/Parulekar personal, not Company; no board record.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Parties dealt with shares as owners.

court_reasoning.text: Loans operative; repayments from own funds (some disputed but others confirmed); secured; lower interest to accommodate.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Ramnath paid own funds in several instances.

court_reasoning.text: s.91B: Interested director vote excluded, no quorum; allotment irregular/voidable by Company, but Company affirmed; valid.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Quorum must be disinterested; transaction voidable, not void; Company waived.

court_reasoning.text: Narayandas estopped: Director, party to resolution, allowed business on footing of subscription.
Dec 27,1951: Book entries = payment/loan; credited Ramnath, debited Narayandas; acknowledged; as if cash paid and returned to discharge debt.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Payment by book transfer valid per Contract Act.

court_reasoning.text: s.54A point not raised properly in pleadings/issues below; no place in statement of case; not open in appeal.

holdings.text: Allotment of 2000 shares valid despite irregularity under s.91B; Company affirmed.
Loans to Ramnath/Narayandas genuine, repayable; book entries valid loan.
s.54A not applicable as not properly raised.

precedents_cited.case_name: Transvaal Lands Co. v. New Belgium Transvaal Land and Development Co.
precedents_cited.relevance: Irregular meeting due to interested director voidable by company.

precedents_cited.case_name: In re Yuill Greymouth Point Elizabeth Railway and Coal Company Ltd.
Pratt (Bombay) Ltd. v. M.T. Ltd.; Sassoon & Co. Ltd. v. Pratt (Bombay) Ltd.

precedents_cited.relevance: Director estopped from challenging own invalid allotment.

statutes_cited.name: Indian Companies Act, 1913
statutes_cited.relevance: Minimum subscription; interested director quorum/vote; prohibition on financial assistance for share purchase.

statutes_cited.name: Indian Contract Act, 1872
statutes_cited.relevance: Payment by book transfer entries valid.

outcome.summary: Supreme Court upheld High Court decrees in both suits, confirming recovery of dues from appellants on loans; allotment and loans valid; s.54A point disallowed.
outcome.relief_granted: Decrees in favor of Bank of Poona Ltd. for recovery of loan amounts.

key_quotes.text: "a quorum must be a disinterested quorum, and must be comprised of directors who are entitled to vote on the particular matter before the meeting."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Core principle on s.91B and validity of resolutions.

key_quotes.text: "The voting by the interested director, of itself, does not invalidate the contract. The effect of s.91B is that the vote of the interested director must be excluded, and if as a result of such exclusion there is no quorum, the resolution sanctioning the contract is irregular and the contract is liable to be avoided by the company."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Distinguishes void vs voidable; Company can affirm.

key_quotes.text: "To support a plea of payment, it is not necessary to show that cash passed. Illustration (a) to s.50 of the Indian Contract Act shows that payment may be made by means of transfer entries in books of account."
key_quotes.speaker: court
